vQzi84Gc.question: How would you correctly transmit a distress message?

options.text: Mayday mayday mayday, ground station callsign, your callsign, nature of distress, position, your intentions
Ground station callsign, mayday mayday mayday, your callsign, nature of distress, position, your intentions
Mayday mayday mayday, ground station callsign, your callsign, nature of distress, position, your intentions, mayday mayday mayday
Ground station callsign, your callsign, mayday mayday mayday, nature of distress, position, your intentions

0lUkP5mB.question: On a pilot’s active VHF frequency, another traffic has declared a state of urgency. Urgency is defined as a condition...

options.text: concerning the safety of an aircraft or other vehicle, or of some person on board or within sight, but which does not require immediate assistance.
concerning the immediate safety of an aircraft or other vehicle, or of some person on board or within sight, which requires immediate assistance.
concerning the illegal seizure of an aircraft in transit and forcing it to go to a different destination, which requires immediate assistance.
of being in serious and/or imminent danger and of requiring immediate assistance.

wAtsDkQl.question: You receive an urgency message on the international distress frequency, but no other station answers. You are required, amongst other actions, to..

options.text: acknowledge the message to the aircraft in the state of urgency, then take immediate action to make all necessary information available to the appropriate Air Traffic Service unit.

retransmit the urgency message as it was originally transmitted on the international distress frequency using your own call sign, but do not communicate directly with the aircraft that made the original transmission.
acknowledge the message to the aircraft in the state of urgency, and await for instructions from the pilot of the calling aircraft.

retransmit the urgency message as it was originally transmitted on the frequency with which you are in communication with ATC, but do not communicate directly with the aircraft that made the original transmission.

XXWLQgaA.question: You receive an urgency message on the international distress frequency, but no other station answers. You are required, amongst other actions, to...

options.text: acknowledge the message to the aircraft in the state of urgency, then take immediate action to make all necessary information available to the appropriate Air Traffic Service unit.

retransmit the urgency message as it was originally transmitted on the frequency with which you are in communication with ATC, but do not communicate directly with the aircraft that made the original transmission.

retransmit the urgency message as it was originally transmitted on the international distress frequency using your own call sign, but do not communicate directly with the aircraft that made the original transmission.
acknowledge the message to the aircraft in the state of urgency, and await any instructions the pilot might give you.

aek5Qvaa.question: Which of the following messages most closely reflect the correct format for an Urgency message?

options.text: Pan Pan, Pan Pan, Pan Pan, Brest Approach, GXYBC, in-flight medical emergency, diverting to Brest, 5nm south of Ushant FL 150, heading 280.
Pan Pan, Pan Pan, Pan Pan, GXYBC, 5nm south of Ushant, in-flight medical emergency, diverting to Brest.
Pan Pan Pan, Brest Approach, GXYBC, in-flight medical emergency, 5nm south of Ushant, diverting to Brest.
Pan Pan Pan, Brest Approach, GXYBC, 5nm south of Ushant, in-flight medical emergency, diverting to Brest.

9RJYzoJo.question: An aircraft in state of emergency shall squawk..

6n9ths9e.question: On a flight, you are in radio contact with Midfield Approach when you assume yourself to be in serious and imminent danger. What would be the correct prefix for your initial emergency message and on which frequency should you send it?

options.text: MAYDAY on the frequency of Midfield Approach
MAYDAY on the emergency frequency 121.5 MHz
PAN PAN on the frequency of Midfield Approach
PAN PAN on the emergency frequency 121.5 MHz

HWMBWzL3.question: What action should be taken by the aircraft station first receiving a distress message if no station replies?

options.text: Immediately acknowledge the distress message.
Ask the station to change to frequency 121.5 MHz.
Request position of the station in distress.
Request the nature of emergency in progress, and request further intentions.

zBhIfT4C.question: Which frequency shall be used for the first transmission of a 'MAYDAY' call?'

options.text: The frequency currently in use.
Any other international emergency frequency.
The distress frequency 121.5 MHz.
Any frequency at pilot`s discretion.

IAmd2bf2.question: When an aircraft station receives the call "ALL STATIONS, STEPHENVILLE RADAR, STOP TRANSMITTING, MAYDAY" it is requested:

options.text: not to interfere with the distress communication.
to assist Stephenville RADAR in handling the distress traffic.
to continue normal communication on the frequency in use.
to leave the frequency in use.

N1fSlPy5.question: Following a distress traffic situation that has been terminated what is the correct transmission from the controlling ATC unit?

options.text: All stations - distress traffic ended
All stations - distress traffic terminated
"All stations - Mayday traffic terminated"
All stations - distress message over

rM7JZ8Sm.question: Following a distress traffic situation that has been terminated what is the correct transmission from the controlling ATC unit?

options.text: "All stations - distress traffic ended"
"All stations - Mayday traffic ended"
"All stations - Mayday traffic terminated"
"All stations - distress traffic terminated"

ayiwr22o.question: You have declared an emergency, and landed. ATC then transfers you to another frequency. What is the primary reason for such frequency transfer?

options.text: ATC removes the emergency aircraft from the Tower frequency in order to restore the regular flow of traffic.
To ensure confidentiality, a special frequency is used that cannot be monitored by 'Live ATC' services or aviation band scanners.
The support from ATC for the emergency traffic ends once the emergency aircraft has landed.
To allow for direct contact between the emergency aircraft and rescue and firefighting services on a discrete frequency.

xs3mGasi.question: You are the pilot of a single-engined piston aircraft on a 3-hour IFR flight. You have been monitoring a slightly increased oil temperature for the last hour. For the last 10 minutes you have been observing various urgency messages on your radio frequency. If you were to transmit a distress message, what would be the priority of urgency messages in relation to distress messages as per the order of aeronautical radio messages? Urgency messages...

options.text: have the second highest priority.
have the third highest priority.
have the highest priority.
are routine radio messages that have NO special priority.

Jmez3y24.question: After declaring a state of urgency to ATC,on what frequency must the pilot normally maintain listening watch?

options.text: The frequency in use at the time, unless advised by the air traffic controller.
Company frequency.
The international distress frequency.
Guard frequency.

hRv7q8NZ.question: The frequency used for the first transmission of a MAYDAY call shall be:

options.text: the frequency currently in use.
any frequency at pilot's discretion.
any other international emergency frequency.
the distress frequency 121.5 MHz.

eoZVTOnE.question: When an aircraft station receives the call 'ALL STATIONS, STEPHENVILLE RADAR, STOP TRANSMITTING, MAYDAY' it is requested

options.text: not to interfere with the distress communication.
to leave the frequency in use.
to continue normal communication on the frequency in use.
to assist Stephenville RADAR in handling the distress traffic.

eRMQuyHN.question: Radio silence can be imposed by an aeronautical station in the event of

options.text: distress traffic.
an overload of the frequency.
an urgency communication.
technical difficulties.

FOPZ3Uxc.question: A pilot in flight hears an urgency message but does not hear any station replying. What action must the pilot take?

options.text: Acknowledge the urgency message.
Return to the previous frequency to avoid interfering with urgency communications.
Squawk 7700 and re-transmit all urgency messages received on the emergency frequency 121.5 MHz.
Stop transmitting on the frequency until the Air Traffic Services provide replies.

MoxguxKV.question: You hear a distress message on guard and nobody responds; what are your actions?

options.text: Acknowledge the transmission and immediately relay the message to the appropriate ATSU.
Repeat the transmission on guard using your own callsign
Repeat the transmission on the frequency in use.
Acknowledge the transmission and await further instructions from the aircraft.

9HtfPuNK.question: After the words PAN PAN three times, an ideal urgency message should contain information on certain elements, preferably given in a specific order. Which option most accurately describes the ideal urgency message?

options.text: Name of the station addressed, call sign, nature of the urgency condition, pilot’s intentions, position, level and heading.
Name of the station addressed, nature of urgency condition, call sign, heading, airspeed, pilot’s intentions, any other useful information.
Call sign, last known position, time at that position, altitude, pilot’s intentions.
Last known position, airspeed, pilot’s intentions, altitude.

kVqmYKYR.question: What is the definition of urgency? A condition..

options.text: concerning the safety of an aircraft other vehicles or of a person on board, but which does not require immediate assistance.
concerning the attitude of an aircraft when intercepting the localizer during an ILS approach which does not require immediate assistance.
concerning the safety of a person on board or within sight and requiring immediate assistance.
of being threatened by serious and/or imminent danger and of requiring immediate assistance.

vV9WvGAW.question: The state of URGENCY is a condition that can be defined in the following way:

options.text: there is concern about the safety of the aircraft or a person on board but it does not require immediate assistance.
the aircraft is threatened by serious or imminent danger and requires an immediate assistance.
there are warnings of severe weather occurrence that is likely to affect the aircraft safety.
there is an emergency situation on the ground.

GITLltH9.question: What is the purpose of tower transferring distress traffic to a discrete frequency?

options.text: To bring back the orderly flow of other traffic.
To allow distress traffic be in direct contact with the company.
To allow distress traffic be in direct contact with fire and rescue services.
So that other aircraft are not aware of what is happening, avoiding panic.

nsWAI7vr.question: A radiotelephony distress message should start with the following signal

options.text: Mayday, Mayday, Mayday
Urgency, Urgency, Urgency
Distress, Distress, Distress
Monday, Monday ,Monday

4AO46lOB.question: Which of the following frequencies is an international emergency frequency?

options.text: 6500 KHz

m2hZO8uA.question: Which of the following frequencies is an international emergency frequency?

OPBouGV9.question: Which of the following frequencies is an international emergency frequency?

options.text: 911 MHZ
6500 KHZ

uR9kKcmc.question: When distress communication is in progress, what action should all other stations on the concerned frequency take?

options.text: Return to the previously used frequency.
Change over to frequency 121.5 MHz
Relay the distress message to other stations.
Stop transmitting messages.

aVbqn2Lt.question: What does the transponder code 7700 indicate? That the aircraft is:

options.text: In an emergency.
Entering a controlled airspace without previous clearance.
Experiencing a communication failure.
Not receiving a radar service.

aZk0ACOW.question: Under which circumstances shall an aircraft squawk 7700?

options.text: In distress.
When following a SID.
When flying within controlled airspace.
When passing the transition level.

3968XNzT.question: A signal sent by radiotelephony consisting of the words "PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN" means..

options.text: The aircraft has an urgent message to transmit concerning the safety of a ship, aircraft or other vehicle, but immediate assistance is not required.
imminent danger threatens the aircraft and immediate assistance is required.
an aircraft on final approach is starting the missed approach procedure.
the aircraft is diverting from the route cleared because of a thunderstorm and asks for immediate reclearance.

2C5kILzF.question: A pilot has just tuned into the frequency for Seville approach and the first transmission he/she hears is: "G-AFFD, cancelling distress". This indicates that the aircraft is..

options.text: no longer in distress.
no longer declaring a state of urgency.
declaring a distress situation.
cancelling an IFR flight plan.

NnpRL3jL.question: The distress communication and silence conditions shall be terminated by transmitting a message. Which words shall this message include?

options.text: DISTRESS TRAFFIC ENDED.
DISREGARD DISTRESS COMMUNICATION, OUT.
MAYDAY TRAFFIC ENDED.
EMERGENCY COMMUNICATION FINISHED.

3cq6eWfk.question: An aircraft which is equipped with SSR transponder is intercepted by another aircraft. It shall, unless otherwise instructed by the appropriate air traffic service unit, select the following transponder code and mode:

options.text: Code 7700 Mode A
Code 7500 Mode A
Code 7600 Mode C
Code 7700 Mode C

xyh7zAdE.question: Distress and urgency messages shall normally be maintained on the air-ground frequency used at the time, until...

options.text: it is considered that better assistance can be provided by transferring that traffic to another frequency.
search and rescue services take over responsibility for all communications in 121.5 MHz.
the flight crew members are ready to switch over to 243.0 MHz.
company dispatch are ready to take responsibility for and manage the situation on their specific allocated company frequency.

MkV2rJEH.question: On hearing an urgency message a pilot shall:

options.text: monitor the frequency to ensure assistance if required.
impose radio silence on the frequency in use.
change the frequency, because radio silence will be imposed on the frequency in use.
acknowledge the message immediately.

K4s2KjEM.question: When hearing a distress message, but ATC does not reply, what should a pilot do? - Maintain radio silence. - Immediately acknowledge the distress message. - Relay information to the appropriate ATS unit. - Take control of the communications or specifically and clearly transfer that responsibility, advising the aircraft if a transfer is made. - Switch to alternate frequency for further communication with ATC.

OyICPX42.question: A distress call has been made to an ATC unit by other traffic on the frequency. Under which conditions is a pilot allowed to transmit a message? - For the transmission of a flight safety message. - The distress is cancelled, or distress traffic is terminated. - The distress traffic has been transferred to other frequencies. - The pilot approaches the edge of the ATC unit’s area of responsibility. - The station in control of the communication has given permission.

hGaIQ9Ue.question: When distress communications and silence conditions have been terminated, which message shall the controlling station transmit?

options.text: Distress traffic ended.
Disregard distress communication, OUT.
Emergency communication finished.
MAYDAY traffic ended.

wj9slV6k.question: During cruise, the senior cabin crew member notifies the flight crew that two armed men are threatening the cabin crew and the passengers. Which SSR code should the flight crew use in this scenario?

options.text: concerning the safety of an aircraft other vehicles or of a person on board, but which does not require immediate assistance.
concerning the attitude of an aircraft when intercepting the localizer during an ILS approach which does not require immediate assistance.
of being threatened by serious and/or imminent danger and of requiring immediate assistance.
concerning the safety of a person on board or within sight and requiring immediate assistance.

7aAkIlMp.question: Which frequency shall be used for the first transmission of a "MAYDAY" call?

options.text: The frequency currently in use.
The distress frequency 121.5 MHz.

imsWJOnc.question: Radio silence can be imposed by an aeronautical station in the event of...

options.text: distress traffic.
an urgency communication.
technical difficulties.

drZmZuKc.question:
Complete the following sentence:
Distress and urgency messages shall normally be maintained on the air-ground frequency used at the time, until__.

options.text: It is considered that better assistance can be provided by transferring that traffic to another frequency.
Search and rescue services take over responsibility for all communications in 121.5 MHz.
Company dispatch are ready to take responsibility for and manage the situation on their specific allocated company frequency.
The flight crew members are ready to switch over to 243.0 MHz.

dvNACvii.question: Radio silence can be imposed by an aeronautical station in case of

options.text: distress traffic.
overload of the frequency.
technical difficulties.

bHrphSMW.question: An urgency message shall be preceded by the radiotelephony urgency signal...

options.text: PAN PAN, spoken three times.
URGENCY, spoken three times.
MAYDAY, spoken three times.

HxrutL3W.question: An aircraft in distress shall send the following signal by radiotelephony:

options.text: MAYDAY, MAYDAY, MAYDAY
URGENCY, URGENCY, URGENCY
PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN
DETRESFA, DETRESFA, DETRESFA

XPOMaq2n.question:
"PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN, Lille, F-GTPO, losing engine power, requesting immediate landing runway 20, right hand base for runway 20".
What type of message is the above?

options.text: Urgency
Distress
Flight safety
Flight regularity

rE7QVerP.question: A signal sent by radiotelephony consisting of the words "MAYDAY MAYDAY MAYDAY" means..

options.text: imminent danger threatens the aircraft and immediate assistance is required.
the aircraft has a message to transmit concerning adverse weather conditions along its route.
the aircraft is forced to perform a fuel dumping procedure.
the aircraft has a very urgent message to transmit concerning the safety of a ship, aircraft or vehicle.

Zb9wAkOJ.question: On approach your pre-landing checks reveal that the landing gear may not be fully lowered. You are going to request a fly by of the tower for a visual inspection to confirm gear status. Which of the following would be the correct level and sequence of your message?

options.text: Pan pan (x3), Station being called, your callsign, reason, intentions...
Mayday (x3), station being called, your callsign, reason, intentions...
Pan pan (x3), your callsign, station being called,  reason, intentions...
Mayday (x3), station being called, reason, intentions, your callsign...

Bf5qJdfT.question: You hear an urgency message on the international emergency frequency but no station replies. You...

options.text: acknowledge the reception of the message and relay the information to the appropriate ATS unit.
acknowledge the reception of the message and wait for instructions from the pilot of the calling aircraft.
relay the message to the ATS unit with which you are currently communicating but don't communicate directly with the calling aircraft.
relay the message on the international emergency frequency but don't communicate directly with the calling aircraft.

kr4A4Msn.question:
Two aircraft are experiencing communication failure
	Aircraft A is on a VFR flight on the downwind leg to land at a controlled aerodrome
	Aircraft B is also on a VFR flight cruising at FL55
	Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: A watch shall be kept by the pilot of aircraft A as instructions may be issued by visual signals.
For both aircraft, the general communication failure procedures of the ICAO Rules of the Air override any published local procedures.
Season the beaten eggs well with salt and pepper. Heat the oil and butter in a non-stick frying pan over a medium-low heat until the butter has melted and is foaming.
The arrival report can be omitted by the pilot of aircraft A, as there is an ATC unit at the aerodrome, but one must still be filed at the aerodrome reporting office at the aerodrome of departure.

5MP9gzu4.question: Shortly after the initial contact the following transmission is heard on 118.550 MHz, the Lille Tower frequency: "Mayday, Mayday, Mayday, Lille Tower, F-GTPO, complete engine failure, attempting a forced landing on a grass strip parallel to runway 20, currently right hand downwind for runway 20, 1000 ft." Is the transmission following the standards for declaring an emergency?

options.text: The necessary elements are transmitted in the specified order and on the frequency in use at the time.
Even if the transmission is made on the frequency in use at the time, the position report shall be placed just after the call sign of the aircraft transmitting, if possible.
Emergency transmissions shall always be made on 121.500 MHz, and the position report shall be placed just after the call sign of the aircraft transmitting, if possible.
Even if the necessary elements are transmitted in the specified order, emergency transmissions shall be made on 121.500 MHz.

gyaNm027.question:
F-GTPO has already been in contact with Lille Tower, and sends the following message 

'PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN, Lille Tower, F-HDJF, smoke on board, right hand base for runway 20,requesting immediate landing runway 20.' 

Which of the following statements is correct as regards the compliance of the message with the standards for urgency and emergency transmissions?

options.text: The order of the elements in this urgency message is incorrect, if possible, the present position shall follow the intentions of the person in command.
The order of the elements in this urgency message is correct.
The order of the elements in this emergency message is incorrect, if possible, the present position shall follow the intentions of the person in command.
The order of the elements in this emergency message is correct.

EjhneNqj.question: An urgency message shall be preceded by the radiotelephony urgency signal

options.text: PAN PAN, spoken three times.
URGENCY, spoken three times.
MAYDAY, spoken three times.
ALERFA, spoken three times.

itbkghhT.question:
Refer to Jeppesen GSPRM Training Route Manual - ABERDEEN -Chart 13-1
During a flight to Aberdeen an aircraft has just been handed over from approach control to the tower. After a short while, one of the two engines is suffering an engine fire. Which of the following frequencies should be used to send the distress call?

options.text: one one eight decimal one
one one nine decimal zero five zero
one one four decimal three
one two one decimal seven

Q8W0hWTW.question: An urgency call should include the following information:

options.text: Callsign of station addressed, aircraft callsign, nature of urgency condition, intention of the person in command, position, level, heading.
Callsign, position, route, destination, endurance.
Callsign of the station addressed, aircraft callsign, present position, level, ETA destination.
Name of the pilot in command, number of persons on board.

z7Px0tUz.question: An urgency message shall be preceded by the signal PAN PAN. It shall also contain as many of the following items as necessary. According to ICAO, what is the ideal order for reporting these items? - The name of the station being addressed - The identification of the aircraft - Present position, level (i.e. flight level, altitude, etc.,as appropriate) and heading - The nature of the urgency condition - The intention of the PIC - Any other useful information

fGxGXocO.question: You are on an approach for landing, and you receive a warning that the undercarriage might not be down. You request the tower for a flyby. Which of the following answers covers the correct phraseology and order or information?

options.text: PAN PAN x3, station’s call sign, aircraft’s call sign, the reason for the distress, intentions.
MAYDAY x3, station’s call sign, aircraft’s call sign, the reason for the distress, intentions.
PAN PAN PAN, station’s call sign, aircraft’s call sign, the reason for the distress, intentions.
MAYDAY x3, station’s call sign, aircraft’s call sign, request immediate flyby.

bkScXjAD.question: A signal sent by radiotelephony consisting of the words 'MAYDAY MAYDAY MAYDAY' means

options.text: imminent danger threatens the aircraft and immediate assistance is required.
the aircraft has a message to transmit concerning adverse weather conditions along its route.
the aircraft is forced to perform a fuel dumping procedure.
the aircraft has a very urgent message to transmit concerning the safety of a ship, aircraft or vehicle.

Qq6LZNQg.question: When can an aircraft station resume normal communications after a distress call has been sent?

options.text: After the phrase "distress traffic ended" has been sent.
If the ground station authorizes to do so.
After the distress traffic has been transferred to another frequency.
Anytime.

zrW58cyY.question: Which of the following messages shall a station in control of distress use to impose silence?

options.text: Stop transmitting, MAYDAY.
Stop transmitting, EMERGENCY.
Stop transmitting, DISTRESS.
All stations in this frequency, MAYDAY traffic.

GkgsEqBp.question: You have been contracted by a government agency to transport passengers who are all medical personnel to an area of conflict. To ensure priority, what message should you pass when in contact with an ATS unit?After the urgency signal PAN PAN three times followed by the radiotelephony signal..

options.text: "Medical", state your call sign, your position, type, intended route, estimated time of arrival at destination, and current altitude.
"Special handling", state your call sign, your position, intended route, current altitude, and transponder capability.
"Medical", state your call sign, your position, estimated time of arrival at destination, and current transponder setting.
"Special handling", state your call sign, your position, intended route, estimated time of arrival at destination, and current altitude.

RCM14TZY.question: On the pilot’s active VHF frequency, another traffic has declared a state of urgency. Urgency is defined as a condition..

options.text: concerning the safety of an aircraft or other vehicle, or of some person on board or within sight, but which does not require immediate assistance.
of being in serious and/or imminent danger and of requiring immediate assistance.
concerning the illegal seizure of an aircraft in transit and forcing it to go to a different destination, which requires immediate assistance.
concerning the immediate safety of an aircraft or other vehicle, or of some person on board or within sight, which requires immediate assistance.

4G1kUjsG.question:
Refer to figure. 
 During a flight to Aberdeen airport, you are handed over from Approach to Tower. Minutes later, you suffer an engine failure. On which frequency should you report your engine failure?

x5CD6vLJ.question: Which statement about emergency communication is correct?

options.text: Urgency communications have priority over all the other communications, except distress communications.
Urgency communications have priority over all the other communications.
Distress communications have the same priority as urgency communications.
ATC clearances have the same priority as urgency communications.

EeLjKNFm.question: When distress communications are in progress, what action should all other stations on the concerned frequency take?

options.text: Stop transmitting on the frequency.

lbm8aqkT.question: A signal sent by radiotelephony consisting of the words PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN means...

options.text: The aircraft has an urgent message to transmit concerning the safety of a ship, aircraft or other vehicle, but immediate assistance is not required.
an aircraft on final approach is starting the missed approach procedure.
the aircraft is diverting from the route cleared because of a thunderstorm and asks for immediate reclearance.
imminent danger threatens the aircraft and immediate assistance is required.

a condition concerning the safety of a person on board or within sight and requiring immediate assistance.

lmSDnpcK.question: The distress communications have absolute priority over all other communications, and a station aware of them shall not transmit on the frequency concerned, unless: - to transmit a safety message. - the distress is cancelled or the distress traffic is terminated. - all distress traffic has been transferred to other frequencies. - when approaching the edge of the area under the ATC unit's responsibility. - the station controlling communications gives permission.

TjUXIgYm.question: A signal sent by radiotelephony consisting of the spoken words "PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN" means:

imminent danger threatens the aircraft and immediate assistance is required.
an aircraft on final approach is starting the missed approach procedure.
the aircraft is diverting from the route cleared because of a thunderstorm and asks for immediate reclearance.

c3fORcrE.question: What does it indicate to the ground station, if an aircraft is squawking 7700?

options.text: The aircraft is in distress.

TzkOw7lW.question: When an aircraft station receives the call ALL STATIONS Stephenville RADAR, stop transmitting MAYDAY, what is requested?

options.text: Not to interfere with the distress communication.

lkHh2Dsu.question: On hearing an urgency message a pilot should..

options.text: monitor the frequency and offer assistance if required.
acknowledge the message immediately.
impose radio silence on the frequency in use.
change the frequency because radio silence will be imposed on the frequency in use.

fNcep1Ew.question:
When hearing a distress message, what should the first station listening to the message do?

1. Maintain radio silence2. Immediately acknowledge the distress message3. Relay information to the appropriate ATS unit4. Take control of the communications or specifically and clearly transfer that responsibility, advising the aircraft if a transfer is made5. Switch to alternate frequency for further communication with ATC

tiku6dtI.question:
A pilot needs to transmit a message to ATC that starts with "MAYDAY", preferably spoken three times. The elements of the message are listed below. What is the preferred sequence for transmitting the elements of the message?
1. Current position, 2 NM south of Trent VOR, 5000 feet, heading 320°2. Engine fire3. Scottish Control4. Returning back to EGNX5. G-ABFF

f0GXmGQc.question: An ideal urgency message should start with the phrase PAN PAN, spoken three times, and then contain certain information, preferably in a specific order. Which of the following most accurately describes the ideal urgency message?

options.text: Name of the station addressed, callsign, nature of the urgency condition, pilot’s intentions, position, level and heading
Last known position, airspeed, pilot’s intentions and altitude
Name of the station addressed, nature of urgency condition, callsign, heading, airspeed, pilot’s intentions and any other useful information

WIOQpDQ7.question: An aircraft, callsign SP-ABC, has already been in contact with Lille tower and is now transmitting the following message: "PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN, Lille Tower, SP-ABC, smoke on board, right hand base for runway 22, request immediate landing runway 22." Which of the following messages is correct, when considering the compliance of the message with the standards for urgency and emergency transmissions?

options.text: The order of the items in this urgency message is wrong, if possible, the present position should follow the intentions of the pilot.
The order of the items in this emergency message is wrong, if possible, the present position should follow the intentions of the pilot.
The order of the items in this urgency message is correct.

5WOyixK8.question: What is the definition of distress?

options.text: A condition of being threatened by serious and/or imminent danger and requiring immediate assistance.
A condition concerning the safety of a person on board of an aircraft, or within sight, and requiring immediate assistance.
A condition concerning the attitude of an aircraft when intercepting the localizer during an ILS approach.
A condition concerning the safety of an aircraft or of a person on board, but which does not require immediate assistance.

53IBA4J6.question: In a distress situation it may be necessary to impose silence either on all stations or on a particular station. This action of imposing silence may be performed:

qKKvkHL0.question: You have been contracted by the government to carry a cargo consisting solely of medical supplies and personnel to a conflict area. To ensure priority, what message should you pass when in contact with an ATS unit?

options.text: After the prefix PAN PAN three times, followed by the word “MEDICAL”, state your call sign, your position, type, intended route, estimated time of arrival at destination, and current altitude.

Vj7sP5xI.question: On a VHF frequency, you heard an urgency call from another aircraft which was acknowledged by ATC. What do you do?

bn4OTXB8.question: The pilot of a single engined piston engine aircraft on an IFR flight experiences an engine failure. options.text: He/she should continue talking to Bern radar and provide updates on his/her intentions.

zXXw4nCx.question: A pilot is flying into Aberdeen Dyce airport and has just been handed over from approach to tower frequency. A short while later, the instruments indicate that the aircraft has suffered an engine fire. Which frequency must the pilot transmit the distress call on?

One one niner decimal zero five zero.

VqyU5l6M.question:
What is the ICAO recommended format for an urgency message?
1) The name of the station being addressed
2) The identification of the aircraft
3) Present position, level (i.e. flight level, altitude, etc.,as appropriate) and heading
4) The nature of the urgency condition
5) The intention of the PIC
6) Any other useful information

g9EeM7HH.question: Shortly after take-off for a cross-country flight from Walden, with the call sign Fastair 789,one of your passengers informs you about feeling unwell. You are already in the control area of Alexander Control. A message must be sent to Alexander Control. Which option is most accurately in compliance with the standards for messages on this type of situation? "PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN.."

options.text: ALEXANDER CONTROL, FASTAIR 789, A PASSENGER IS FEELING UNWELL, RETURNING TO WALDEN, 20 MILES WEST OF WALDEN, FL150, HEADING 280.
ALEXANDER CONTROL, FASTAIR 789, 20 MILES WEST OF WALDEN, ESTIMATED TIME EN ROUTE 20 MINUTES, ESTIMATED ARRIVAL 35, FL150, TRANSPONDER CHARLIE, ONE SICK PASSENGER ON BOARD, RETURNING TO WALDEN.
MEDICAL, FASTAIR 789, A PASSENGER IS FEELING UNWELL, RETURNING TO WALDEN, 20 MILES WEST OF WALDEN, FL150, HEADING 280.
MEDICAL, FASTAIR 789, 20 MILES WEST OF WALDEN, ONE SICK PASSENGER ON BOARD, RETURNING TO WALDEN, ESTIMATED TIME EN ROUTE 20 MINUTES, ESTIMATED ARRIVAL 35, FL150, TRANSPONDER CHARLIE.

sXAK6iIe.question: An aircraft with the call sign Flugprop 565 is in the cruise at FL180 heading south, passing the waypoint RODRI, in contact with Brussels Control. Suddenly a fire develops on board and immediately the pilot decides to descend to FL 70 and divert to the nearest suitable airport Brussels-Charleroi (EBCI), located to the right of track. The recommended order to communicate this emergency situation to ATC, if possible, is...

options.text: Mayday, Mayday, Mayday, Brussels Control, Flugprop 565, fire on board, diverting to Charleroi, position RODRI, descending FL 70, heading 180°
Brussels Control, Flugprop 565, Mayday, Mayday, Mayday, descending FL 70, turning right to Charleroi, passing RODRI, fire on board.
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday, Brussels Control, Flugprop 565, passing RODRI, fire on board, descending FL 70 and turning right to Charleroi, diverting, Mayday, Mayday, Mayday
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday, Brussels Control, turning right to Charleroi due to fire on board, descending FL 70, passing RODRI, diverting, Flugprop 565

9oiPZEvi.question:
F-GTPO has already been in contact with Lille Tower, and sends the following message 

'?PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN, Lille Tower, F-HDJF, smoke on board, right hand base for runway 20,requesting immediate landing runway 20.'
	Which of the following statements is correct as regards the compliance of the message with the standards for urgency and emergency transmissions??

options.text: The order of the elements in this urgency message is incorrect, if possible, the present position shall follow the intentions of the person in command.
The order of the elements in this emergency message is incorrect, if possible, the present position shall follow the intentions of the person in command.
The order of the elements in this emergency message is correct.
The order of the elements in this urgency message is correct.

NeX9fmyp.question: F-HDJF has already been in contact with Lille Tower, and sends the following message: "PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN, Lille Tower, F-HDJF, smoke on board, right hand base for runway 20,requesting immediate landing runway 20." options.text: The order of the elements in this urgency message is incorrect, if possible, the present position shall follow the intentions of the person in command.

The order of the elements in this urgency message is correct.
The order of the elements in this emergency message is incorrect, if possible, the present position shall follow the intentions of the person in command.

zLcyqYti.question: Other traffic on your current frequency transmits a distress call to ATC. You must not transmit on the frequency unless..

BG6MYSKh.question: Setting a transponder code **7700** indicates that the aircraft:

options.text: is in emergency.

BZYsqYwu.question:

options.text: Acknowledge the urgency message.

rUYvyeF1.question: An aircraft in state of emergency shall squawk:

H9OKGYrM.question:

3) All distress traffic has been transferred to other frequencies
4) When approaching the edge of the area under the ATC unit`s responsibility
5) The station controlling communications gives permission.?

xorleQ2U.question:
Following a distress call by other traffic to ATC, under what conditions is a pilot allowed to transmit a message? 
1 To transmit a flight safety message
	
2) The distress is cancelled or the distress traffic is terminated
	
3) All distress traffic has been transferred to other frequencies
	
4) When approaching the edge of the area under the ATC unit`s responsibility
	
5) The station controlling communications gives permission.

GXzLMvlF.question:
Select the correct priority of the following messages;
1: Flight Regularity
2: Meteorological
3: Distress
4: Flight Safety
5: Direction Finding
6: Urgency

BgtVPrZE.question: Which frequency shall be used for the first transmission of a ?MAYDAY' call??

options.text: The frequency currently in use.
Any frequency at pilot`s discretion.
Any other international emergency frequency.
The distress frequency 121.5 MHz.

p0eZr3ml.question: Under which of the following circumstances shall an aircraft squawk **7700**?

options.text: In distress.
When flying within controlled airspace.
When following a SID.
When passing the transition level.

6VdeTyTA.question:
A distress communication is in progress and the ATS unit has already acknowledged the distress message. Which of the following conditions must be met in order for you to transmit on the concerned frequency? 
1. The distress is cancelled. 
2. The distress traffic has been transferred to other frequencies.
3. The ATS unit gives you permission to transmit.
4. You reach your next reporting point.

SjX4qXix.question: The urgency message to be sent by an aircraft reporting an urgency condition should contain at least the following information

options.text: aircraft call sign, nature of the urgency condition, pilot`s intention, present position, level and heading.
name of the station addressed, present position, assistance required.
aircraft call sign, destination airport, ETA at destination, route of flight.
aircraft identification, aerodrome of departure, level and heading.

iva3ZBqU.question: What is the correct transmission of a distress message?

options.text: Mayday mayday mayday, ground station callsign, your callsign, nature of distress, position, your intentions.
Mayday mayday mayday, ground station callsign, your callsign, nature of distress, position, your intentions, mayday mayday mayday.
Ground station callsign, mayday mayday mayday, your callsign, nature of distress, position, your intentions.
Ground station callsign, your callsign, mayday mayday mayday, nature of distress, position, your intentions.

NcOMbgfa.question: On hearing an urgency message a pilot should...

options.text: monitor the frequency and offer assistance if required.
change the frequency because radio silence will be imposed on the frequency in use.
impose radio silence on the frequency in use.
acknowledge the message immediately.

tIFZPbSf.question: When an aircraft station receives the call 'ALL STATIONS Stephenville RADAR, distress traffic ended'

options.text: normal communication with Stephenville RADAR may be resumed.
the aircraft station has to advice the other stations in the vicinity.
the aircraft station has to call Stephenville RADAR to request frequency change.
receipt of this message must be acknowledged.

37vaLRJc.question: According to ICAO Annex 10, an aircraft in distress shall, if possible, include in its distress signal or message specified elements in a specified order. Which option contains an element that can definitely be omitted from such a message (in Annex 10 it is marked with "time and circumstances permitting")?

options.text: Name of the station addressed
Heading
Present position and level
Intention of the person in command

mXx2d3tr.question: A signal sent by radiotelephony consisting of the words MAYDAY MAYDAY MAYDAY means...

options.text: imminent danger threatens the aircraft and immediate assistance is required.
the aircraft has a very urgent message to transmit concerning the safety of a ship, aircraft or vehicle.
the aircraft has a message to transmit concerning adverse weather conditions along its route.
the aircraft is forced to perform a fuel dumping procedure.

WGcqzuBQ.question: An aircraft equipped with SSR transponder which is intercepted by another aircraft shall immediately, unless otherwise instructed by the appropriate air traffic service unit, select the following codes and mode:

options.text: Code 7700 Mode A
Code 7600 Mode C
Code 7500 Mode A
Code 7700 Mode C

T41ULcNG.question:
Traffic on your current frequency has declared a state of urgency.
	After several attempts you notice the controller does not seem to be receiving the urgency message
	What must you do?

options.text: Reply to the urgency message, advise the ATS unit, and if necessary exercise control of communications.
Relay the message on the international guard frequency.
Maintain radio silence until ATC has acknowledged the call.
Confirm receipt of the urgency call with other stations on frequency.

UIkDhRjU.question: Traffic on your current frequency has declared a state of urgency. After several attempts you notice the controller does not seem to be receiving the urgency message. What must you do?

options.text: Reply to the urgency message, advise the ATS unit, and if necessary exercise control of communications.
Maintain radio silence until ATC has acknowledged the call.
Relay the message on the international guard frequency.
Confirm receipt of the urgency call with other stations on frequency.

hdXmhZ6h.question: You are concerned that you are in serious and imminent danger during flight. You are in radio contact with Midfeld Approach. What should you prefix your initial emergency message with, and on what frequency should you send it?

options.text: MAYDAY on Midfeld approach frequency.
PAN PAN on Midfeld approach frequency.
PAN on 121.5 MHz.
MAYDAY on 121.5 MHz.

2IyRDiU5.question: On a pilot's active VHF frequency, another traffic has declared a state of urgency. Urgency is defined as a condition...

options.text: concerning the immediate safety of an aircraft or other vehicle, or of some person on board or within sight, which does not require immediate assistance.
concerning the immediate safety of an aircraft or other vehicle, or of some person on board or within sight, which requires immediate assistance.
concerning the illegal seizure of an aircraft in transit and forcing it to go to a different destination, which requires immediate assistance.
of being in serious and/or imminent danger and of requiring immediate assistance.

XDM9BzMn.question: When an aircraft station receives the call 'ALL STATIONS Stephenville RADAR, stop transmitting MAYDAY', what is requested?

options.text: Not to interfere with the distress communication.
To leave the frequency in use.
To continue normal communication on the frequency in use.
To assist Stephenville RADAR in handling the distress traffic.

OLE7ig8Z.question: What is the definition of urgency? A condition?

options.text: concerning the safety of an aircraft other vehicles or of a person on board, but which does not require immediate assistance.
of being threatened by serious and/or imminent danger and of requiring immediate assistance.
concerning the attitude of an aircraft when intercepting the localizer during an ILS approach which does not require immediate assistance.
concerning the safety of a person on board or within sight and requiring immediate assistance.

F9FW6H7m.question:
A pilot has just tuned into the frequency for Seville approach and the first transmission he/she hears is 'G-AFFD, cancelling distress'
This indicates that the aircraft is?

options.text: no longer in distress.
declaring a distress situation.
cancelling an IFR flight plan.
no longer declaring a state of urgency.

ehk9wqrQ.question: An aircraft has declared an emergency, and has landed. ATC then transfers the aircraft to another frequency. What is the main reason for this frequency transfer?

options.text: ATC removes the emergency aircraft from the Tower frequency in order to restore the regular flow of traffic.
To ensure confidentiality, a special frequency is used that cannot be monitored by 'Live ATC' services or aviation band scanners.
The support from ATC for the emergency traffic ends once the emergency aircraft has landed.
To allow for direct contact between the emergency aircraft and rescue and firefighting services on a discrete frequency.

i4glqo6T.question: Which frequency shall be used for the first transmission of a “MAYDAY” call?

options.text: The frequency currently in use.
Any frequency at pilot`s discretion.
Any other international emergency frequency.
The distress frequency 121.5 MHz.

iohy4YmK.question: When an aircraft station receives the call "ALL STATIONS Stephenville RADAR, distress traffic ended"..

options.text: normal communication with Stephenville RADAR may be resumed.
receipt of this message must be acknowledged.
the aircraft station has to advice the other stations in the vicinity.
the aircraft station has to call Stephenville RADAR to request frequency change.

flEpgiZ2.question: An urgency call shall consist of the following elements / details:

options.text: PAN PAN spoken 3 times (on the frequency in use), name of the station addressed, aircraft identification, the nature of the urgency condition, the intention of the person in command.
PAN PAN spoken 3 times, aircraft identification, the intention of the person in command, heading, height, position.
PAN PAN spoken 3 times (on 121.5 MHz), present position, heading, aircraft identification, the intention of the person in command, the identification of the station being called.
MAYDAY spoken 3 times (on the frequency in use), heading, position, level, aircraft identification, the intention of the person in command.

sszpBOWm.question: Regarding radio telephony procedures, a distress condition is one...

options.text: of serious and/or imminent danger requiring immediate assistance.
concerning the safety of an aircraft, but which does not require immediate assistance.
that requires setting the transponder to 7600.
that requires a PAN PAN broadcast.

rQogmnE2.question: F-GTPO is already in contact with Lille Tower and sends the following message: "PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN, Lille, F-GTPO, losing engine power, requesting immediate landing runway 20, right hand base for runway 20." Which of the following statements is correct as regards the compliance of the message with the standards for urgency transmissions?

options.text: Urgency transmissions shall be made on the air-ground frequency in use at the time.
The urgency standard phrase is MAYDAY instead of PAN PAN.
In urgency transmissions the name of the station addressed shall be omitted or abbreviated to save time.
Urgency transmissions shall be made on the 121.500 MHz frequency.
